post_text:
We're ready for you! Stop by for FREE curbside grab and go meals at the Upper School today until 1:00 p.m. (cafeteria doors). York Academy students and ALL children under 18 in the community are welcome. We will provide one lunch and breakfast per child each day, and the schedule will follow our school calendar (http://bit.ly/YARCS_Calendar). Here’s what’s on the menu:

Lunch: Cheese Pizza or a Picnic Pack (yogurt, cheese, graham snack and cheese crackers)
Broccoli, Assorted Fruit & Milk

Breakfast (for tomorrow): Cereal, Muffin, Fruit, Juice & Milk

Make sure to check out next week's menu at https://bit.ly/3azVkuw. Questions? Contact Food Services Manager, Regina Arnold, at (717) 900-5001 or rarnold@yorkarcs.org.

#meals4kidsinpa #yorkacademyuknighted #yorkacademy #yarcs #ibworldschool #internationalbaccalaureate #yorkpa #iloveyorkcity

post_text:
Tomorrow (9/9/20) is an Early Dismissal Day. Students who are at school for supervision will be dismissed at 12:15 p.m. If your student(s) are learning from home, classes will end at 12:15 p.m. (for K-6) and 12:30 p.m. (for 7-11).

To show our commitment to higher education, students may wear their favorite college/university shirts in place of their uniform shirts on early dismissal days. All other uniform requirements remain the same, and students who do not wish to wear university or college shirts are to wear their uniform shirts.

Since it's an early dismissal day, meals will be available from 11:30 a.m. - 12:30 p.m. at the Upper School (curbside) for students who are learning from home.

#yorkacademyuknighted #yorkacademy #yarcs #ibworldschool #internationalbaccalaureate #yorkpa #iloveyorkcity

post_text:
We're here are waiting for you! Stop by for meals for your students until 1 p.m. at the Upper School (curbside). The prices are based on each student's eligibility with the National School Lunch Program. Here's what's on today's menu:

Lunch: Cheeseburger or a Picnic Pack ( yogurt, cheese stick, graham snack and cheese crackers)
Broccoli, Assorted Fruit, Chocolate Chip Cookie & Milk

Breakfast (for tomorrow): Cereal, Muffin, Fruit, Juice & Milk

Make sure to check out this month's menu at https://bit.ly/3azVkuw.

Please note that even if your child was receiving free or reduced meals last school year, you must complete a new application by 10/1/2020. If your application is not received by then, your child will be removed from the program and you will have to pay full price until you apply. Go to http://www.compass.state.pa.us to apply now.

If you have any questions, contact Food Services Manager, Regina Arnold, at (717) 900-5001 or rarnold@yorkarcs.org. Thank you!

#yorkacademyuknighted #yorkacademy #yarcs #ibworldschool #internationalbaccalaureate #yorkpa #iloveyorkcity

post_text:
As a reminder, if you haven't completed the Back to School Student Information Form yet, please take a few minutes to fill it out today. In the past, this paperwork was sent home with students (First Day Packet). It is now online (http://bit.ly/YARCS-Form), which will make it quicker and easier for you.

Parents/guardians are required to complete the form for each student who attends York Academy. Be prepared to share your emergency contact information and provide consent regarding policies for the 2020-21 school year. As you go through the questions, some of them will pertain to a normal classroom setting. Answer them as if we were fully back in school. Thank you!

#YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #YorkAcademy #YARCS #IBWorldSchool #InternationalBaccalaureate #YorkPA #ILoveYorkCity

post_text:
Stop by for meals for your York Academy students today from 12 - 1 p.m. at the Upper School (curbside). The prices are based on the student's eligibility with the National School Lunch Program. Relatives may pick up the meals, but they will need to provide the student's name at pickup. Here's what's on the menu:

Breakfast (for tomorrow): Cereal & Pop Tart, Fruit, Juice & Milk
Lunch: Ham/Turkey Sub or a Picnic Pack (yogurt, cheese stick, cheese crackers & graham treat)
Fresh Veggies, Assorted Fruit, Potato Chips & Milk
A cheese sandwich is available upon request.

Go to https://bit.ly/3azVkuw to view the menu for this week and next week. You will always be able to view it at www.yorkacademy.com under the Parent Resources tab>Food Services>Menu.

If you have any questions, please contact Food Services Manager, Regina Arnold, at (717) 900-5001 or rarnold@yorkarcs.org. We hope to see you soon!

#yorkacademyuknighted #yorkacademy #yarcs #ibworldschool #internationalbaccalaureate #yorkpa #iloveyorkcity

post_text:
Don't forget! We'll have meals ready for your students at the Upper School (curbside) today from 12 - 1 p.m. The prices are based on the student's eligibility with the National School Lunch Program (breakfast is $1.70 and lunch is $2.75). Students who qualify for free or reduced meals will receive meals free or discounted, as appropriate. Meals will also be available for students to purchase should they not meet National School Lunch Program eligibility guidelines. Relatives may pick up the meals, but they will need to provide the student's name at pickup. Here's what's on the menu:

Breakfast: Cereal & Muffin, Juice & Milk
Lunch: Chef Salad w/Dinner Roll or Ham & Cheese Pack
Fresh Veggies, Assortment of Fruit and Milk
A cheese sandwich is available upon request.

We hope to see you soon!

#yorkacademyuknighted #yorkacademy #yarcs #ibworldschool #internationalbaccalaureate #yorkpa #iloveyorkcity

Stop by for meals for your York Academy students today from 12 - 1 p.m. at the Upper School (curbside). The prices are based on the student's eligibility with the National School Lunch Program. Relatives may pick up the meals, but they will need to provide the student's name at pickup. Please note that breakfast will not be served today (only). Here's what's on the menu:

post_text:
The York Academy uniform and spirit wear store closes tomorrow night at midnight. Students who are coming to school for supervision will need to wear uniforms. Go to https://bit.ly/3gYhlFQ to shop now. Items will be delivered the week of August 31. We will let you know when they arrive so you can pick them up at the school offices.

If you are unsure of the 2020-2021 Dress Code, go to https://bit.ly/2PjXR2o to view it in English or go to https://bit.ly/39RcqDK to view it in Spanish. Families do not have to purchase the uniform items from the store, but they are welcome to do so.

Spirit wear (the non-uniform items) may be worn on early dismissal days (for students who are coming for in-school supervision). This will also be the case when we are able to all come back to school in the future. We will open the store again in the coming months.

#yorkacademy #yarcs #goknights #ibworldschool #internationalbaccalaureate #iloveyorkcity #yorkpa

With the new school year just around the corner, please take this time to explore our online School Store and pay for your student’s fees, including the annual technology fee, at https://www.myschoolbucks.com/ver2/login/getlogin. If their account has fees that are due, you can securely pay for them using your credit/debit card or an echeck. If you need assistance with your account, you can find helpful how-to videos and answers to commonly asked questions by visiting www.myschoolbucks.com. Or, you can contact MySchoolBucks directly by logging into your account to start a chat conversation or give them a call at (855) 832-5226.

We are aware that some parents have been charged twice. We apologize and are looking into the issue. Thank you for your patience as we work with this new component of My School Bucks. If you have questions, please contact the York Academy Business Office at (717) 801-3900.

post_text:
We're excited to kick off the school year and wanted to remind our eLearning families to pick up the necessary materials and technology on Saturday, August 8 from 9:00 a.m - 12:00 p.m. or Monday, August 10 from 3:00 - 6:00 p.m. The locations are:

- Grades K-6: Lower School Gym (32 W. North Street)
- Grades 7-11: Upper School Gym (2 Hamilton Avenue)

If you have your own technology at home, we would appreciate if you would utilize it at this time. Unfortunately, we found out yesterday that a shipment of Chromebooks that we had been counting on will not arrive until mid-September. Even if you plan to use your own technology, you will still need to pick up the required materials so your student(s) are prepared for school. We look forward to seeing you soon!

#YorkAcademyUKnighted #YorkAcademy #YARCS #YARCSeLearning
#UKnight #InternationalBaccalaureate #IBWorldSchool #YorkPA #ILoveYorkCity

post_text:
Come join a knowledgeable team that works collaboratively to create a thriving learning environment for students! Our faculty, staff and administrators strive to model the 10 International Baccalaureate (IB) attributes, which include being open-minded, caring, principled and balanced. As an equal opportunity employer, we invite all qualified applicants to apply for the following positions:

- Kindergarten Teacher
- 6th Grade Teacher
- STEM Teacher (K-6)
- Special Education Teacher (Lower School)
- PYP Coordinator/Instructional Coach (K-6)
- Spanish Teacher (Grades 7 & 8)
- Mathematics Teacher (Grades 7 & 8)
- Instructional Assistant
- Barista/Cafeteria Assistant (Upper School)

Visit http://yorkacademy.com/about/employment to learn more and apply today.

#joinourteam #yorkacademyuknighted #yorkacademy #yarcs #ibworldschool #yorkpa #iloveyorkcity

post_text:
Community Progress Council has been identified by York County and the Pennsylvania Housing & Finance Agency (PHFA) to process applications for Rent Relief Assistance through September 30, 2020 in order to help York County residents impacted by the Coronavirus pandemic.

Qualified tenants may receive up to $750 per month in rental assistance for up to six months for a total of $4,500 through the Pennsylvania Housing & Finance Agency’s CARES Rent Relief Program (RRP). Rental assistance checks are paid directly to the property landlord. In order to qualify, residents must have experienced a 30% or more decrease in income after March 1, 2020. If you (or someone you know) meet these qualifications, please share this post and/or go to https://www.yorkcpc.org/take-action for more information.

post_text: Here's something fun we didn't get to share with you yet! In early March, Food Services Manager, Mrs. Jeannie Linnemans, and her team planned some exciting things for our students during National Breakfast Week. They had the chance cast votes to name a baby calf at Rutter's, but the students never got to find out what name won since we moved to distance learning. Well, here she is…and her name is Rosie! Isn't she beautiful?

Thanks to three dedicated and creative PTO volunteers, there will still be a 2019-2020 YARCS Yearbook (K-10)! Although the year may have ended differently, your children will still be able to have a keepsake that includes photos from many activities.

Yearbooks are on sale through Friday, June 19. Each book costs $20 and may be shipped to your home for a fee or shipped to the school. We will provide a pickup schedule at a later time for those being shipped to the school (will be in July).

Orders may only be placed online. Here are the steps:

Go to www.barksdalephoto.com

Click Order Now

Enter the Access Code/Password: 0035947YB

Enter your email and click continue

Please note that as soon as the Lower School pictures are delivered, we will be in touch, as well. Thank you!

post_text:
Congratulations to the newest members of York Academy's National Art Honor Society!

#YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #YorkAcademy #Creativity #VisualArts #Artists #NAHS #IBWorldSchool
shared_text:
York Academy Visual Arts
June 4 at 8:29 PM ·

Congratulations to these talented young artists, who were inducted into the National Art Honor Society yesterday! Our induction ceremony had to be rescheduled and held virtually this year, but their families and I still had a wonderful time celebrating them and their accomplishments! Thank you for a wonderful year of art, creativity, and service, York Academy Regional Charter School artists! You set high standards for yourselves and continually rise to be positive examples to your peers in both character and academics. It is an honor and a pleasure to be your teacher. <3

York Academy is pleased to offer meals to ALL children under 18 in the community through June 30. The children do not need to be students at York Academy and they do not need to be present in the car to receive the meals. Today's menu choices are:

Option 1: Meatballs, Dinner Roll, Vegetable, Fruit & Milk
Option 2: Cheese Sandwich, Snack, Fruit & Milk
All lunches are served with a take-along breakfast.

If your students are in need of lunch and you have transportation difficulties, please contact Aislinn Cunningham, Student Services Coordinator, at acunningham@yorkarcs.org.

#YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #YorkAcademy #Meals4KidsInPA #IBWorldSchool #YorkPA #ILoveYorkCity

post_text:
Family Fun Night with the American Heart Association - Southcentral PA is only 45 minutes away (6 p.m.)! Make sure to pre-register at https://bit.ly/3esIkaQ! Come get your hearts pumping and have a blast with a dance party, scavenger hunt, workout, karaoke, drawing demo, storytime and more! Make sure to "come" dressed like a knight! And...come find out if Miss Kinard gets turned into a HUMAN SUNDAE!

#KHCFamilyFunNight #UKnighted #YorkAcademy #IBWorldSchool #YorkPA #ILoveYorkCity

post_text:
READY FOR SOME CHALK THE WALK TRIVIA?!

Mrs. Winters and Mrs. Chester will be going LIVE at 1:00PM to kick off the afternoon! We'll also be posting a street painting trivia question at the top of each hour during Chalk the Walk: 1:00, 2:00, 3:00, and 4:00!

The trivia questions will be posted individually, so be sure to answer beneath the appropriate question so that you get credit for your answer.

The first CORRECT answer on each trivia post will receive ONE Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle plush ball (pictured below). Instructions for getting your plush will be shared when each winner is recognized.

Have a great time today!! We can't WAIT to see what you create!! (Remember to email your photos to info@yorkarcs.org and/or post on FB with #ChalktheWalk2020 and #YARCSFamilyFunDay2020. Tag us, too!

Mrs. Chester & Mrs. Winters

post_text:
The Proposed Final Budget for the General Fund of the York Academy Regional Charter School for the 2020-2021 fiscal year in its most recent form is now available at www.yorkacademy.com. It is expected to be presented for adoption as a Final Budget at the Board of Trustees meeting on June 29, 2020 at 5:30 p.m. The budget may be amended before or after final adoption. If an individual is unable to access the document on the York Academy website, a printed copy may be obtained by contacting our Business Manager, Kevin A. Alvarnaz, at kalvarnaz@yorkarcs.org. Thank you!

#YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #YorkAcademy #IBWorldSchool #YorkPA #ILoveYorkCity

post_text:
Family Fun Day is tomorrow, Knights! Get ready for an awesome day centered around the theme of being #UKnighted. Friday is also a School Spirit Day, so let's show our Knight pride! Students are welcome to wear York Academy gear or tops that are teal/cream. Find out all the exciting things that are planned at https://bit.ly/2zuwBtN!

If you'd like to send a picture of your child participating in any of our Family Fun Day activities, please send them to info@yorkarcs.org. The photos may be posted on Facebook and/or Instagram. You're also welcome to post pictures on social media using the hashtags #UKnighted and #YARCSFamilyFunDay2020. Make sure to tag us so we can see all your pictures, too!

Don't forget to register for our Family Fun Night event with the American Heart Association - Southcentral PA (6- 7 p.m.) at https://bit.ly/3esIkaQ. You may even get to see Miss Kinard turn herself into a human sundae!

#YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #YorkAcademy #YorkPA #IBWorldSchool #InternationalBaccalaureate #ILoveYorkCity

post_text:
Stop by for free grab-and-go meals for your kids today from 11:30 a.m. - 12:30 p.m. in the rear parking lot of the Lower School. Plus, they'll get to wave hi to Ms. Rooney, Mrs. Frazier & Mrs. Rock!

York Academy is pleased to offer meals to ALL children under 18 in the community. The children do not need to be students at York Academy and they do not need to be present in the car to receive the meals. Today's menu choices are:

Option 1: Sausage Pizza, Veggie, Fruit & Milk
Option 2: Cheese Sandwich, Snack, Fruit & Milk
All lunches are served with a take-along breakfast.

If your students are in need of lunch and you have transportation difficulties, please contact Aislinn Cunningham, Student Services Coordinator, at acunningham@yorkarcs.org.

post_text:
Congratulations to Alex, an eighth-grader who is this week's #KnightNodFriday (formerly Student Spotlight). He was nominated for embodying the International Baccalaureate attribute of being #balanced. It's critical to understand the importance of balancing the different aspects of our lives—intellectual, physical and emotional—to achieve well-being for ourselves and others. When we are in balance, we recognize our interdependence with other people and with the world in which we live.

Alex has been doing a great job with distance learning. He comes to class with questions and turns in his Language and Literature assignments on time and well done. He has taken this opportunity to really shine academically, while balancing a new "normal" during the pandemic. Here's a big "Knight Nod" for doing your best, Alex. Keep it up!

#YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #YorkAcademy #IBWorldSchool #InternationalBaccalaureate #YorkPA #ILoveYorkCity

post_text:
As an International Baccalaureate World School, York Academy fifth graders participate in an intensive group research project called exhibition. It serves as the capstone for the Primary Years Programme and empowers students to be changemakers. Learn more in this Our York Media story: https://bit.ly/3bByNMY

#YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #YorkAcademy #IBWorldSchool #InternationalBaccalaureate #YorkPA #ILoveYorkCity #Exhibition
shared_text:
OURYORKMEDIA.COM
At York Academy, Exhibition Night is a chance for students to change the world

Our York Media with York Academy Regional Charter School.
Paid Partnership ·

Whether it’s water pollution, smoking, or youth sports safety, fifth-grade students at York Academy Regional Charter School tackle the world’s biggest issues as part of the culmination of the school's Primary Years Programme. Read more about the students' exhibitions here: https://bit.ly/2ZfpT5l.

post_text:
SummerQuest is still happening at York County Libraries! This program offers kids and teens tons of ways to stay active in mind and body all summer long. York County Libraries host free, fun activities that keep participants learning, reading and physically active. Learn more at https://bit.ly/2ySn13A.

#YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #YorkAcademy #IBWorldSchool #InternationalBaccalaureate #ILoveYorkCity
shared_text:
York County Libraries
May 14 at 12:54 PM ·

Yes, SummerQuest is still happening in 2020 at York County Libraries!
Our early registration date is Sunday, May 17 at SummerQuest.yorklibraries.org.
Are you ready to Imagine Your Story this summer?
📚 If you don't already have a library card, or need to renew or update your info, visit Yorklibraries.org and click "Renew My Card" or "Get a Library Card."
📱 Download and register the Beanstack app--it'll be super helpful this summer.
🍃 GO York! is back too, but on a delayed schedule. More details to come!
🌐 Our big kickoff event will be happening ONLINE on May 30, including a livestreamed performance from Steven Courtney at 1pm! We hope to see you all there!

post_text:
Don't forget! Encourager and motivator, Terrence Lee Talley, is hosting two virtual assemblies tomorrow (Thursday) afternoon! He'll be talking to students about handling uncertainty in a fun, uplifting way with hilarious stories, riddles and music. Terrence will ask questions with a happy, competitive nudge for kids to answer quickly using the live chat feature. Before they know it, he'll be having them laughing and sharing time together! Terrence's goal is to give every student hope and empower them to give hope to others.

The assemblies will be interactive through Vimeo. Students may participate in both 45 minute sessions, but the content will be centered on the corresponding grade levels.

1 p.m. - Grades K-3

5 p.m. - Grades 4-7

Make sure to have your child check for the Vimeo links, which are only for York Academy families.

#YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #YorkAcademy #IBWorldSchool #InternationalBaccalaureate #YorkPA #ILoveYorkCity

post_text:
York Academy is thrilled to partner with encourager and motivator, Terrence Lee Talley, for two virtual assemblies on Thursday, May 14! He'll be talking to our students about handling uncertainty in a fun, uplifting way with stories and music! The assemblies will be interactive (live chat) through Vimeo. Students may join in for both 45 minute sessions, but the content will be focused on the specific age group.

1 p.m. - Grades K-3

5 p.m. - Grades 4-7

Students are encouraged to take a survey beforehand to help guide Terrence on the topics they want to hear about most. Click here for the survey: https://bit.ly/2xWCrmT

Learn more about Terrence at https://terrencetalley.com.

Students should watch for the Vimeo link so they can connect on Thursday!

post_text:
Congratulations to Madison, an eighth-grader who is this week's #KnightNodFriday (formerly Student Spotlight). Madi was nominated for embodying the International Baccalaureate #attribute of being #knowledgeable. When we display knowledge, we develop and use conceptual understanding, exploring across a broad range of disciplines. We engage with issues and ideas that have local and global significance.

Madi heavily participates during online instruction, puts forth her best effort on all assignments, turns in her assignments in a timely manner, and continually shows content knowledge and understanding. She asks higher-level questions during class and really showcases what hard work looks like as an eighth grader at YARCS. Way to go, Madi. Here's a big "Knight Nod" for engaging and being knowledgeable. Keep it up!

#YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #YorkAcademy #IBWorldSchool #InternationalBaccalaureate #YorkPA #ILoveYorkCity

post_text:
In the spirit of #ThankfulThursday, we're excited to share this week's Knight Staff Superstar. A huge shoutout goes to Mrs. Melissa Cook for embodying the IB attribute of being #balanced! It's critical to understand the importance of balancing the different aspects of our lives—intellectual, physical and emotional—to achieve well-being for ourselves and others. When we are in balance, we recognize our interdependence with other people and with the world in which we live.

Mrs. Cook has done a great job of providing her students with a quality education and creating space for them to socialize and share during distance learning. She researches the best ways to teach and reach her students, but also makes time for herself and her family. Thanks for being a role model and showing your students how to stay balanced during this challenging time, Mrs. Cook. You are appreciated!

#KnightStaffSuperstar #YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #YorkAcademy #IBWorldSchool #InternationalBaccalaureate #YorkPA #ILoveYorkCity

In case you missed it, we're thrilled to share that 145 people #UKnighted to raise to raise $22,128 during #GiveLocalYork!

Thank you for your amazing generosity and kindness. Your meaningful donations will help ensure our students have the chance to attend the college of their choice - and that they are well prepared to do so.

We are also proud to be one of the 305 nonprofits who raised over $3.5 million dollars for nonprofits in just 24 hours. Congrats, Give Local York! Our community is amazing

post_text:
Please come out for free meals for your children from 11:30 - 12:30 p.m. in the rear parking lot of the Lower School. Starting this week, you'll even get to see some of your favorite teachers! Watch our page to see who will be there each day. Here is the menu for the week:

- Monday: Fish Treasures with Mac and Cheese
- Tuesday: Tangerine Chicken, Rice and Broccoli
- Wednesday: Sweet Bologna and Cheese Sandwich with a Snack
- Thursday: Maxi Sticks with Marinara Sauce
- Friday: Chicken Club Sandwich

Alternative Option: Cheese Sandwich
A take-along breakfast for tomorrow will also be available.

#YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #Meals4KidsInPA #YorkAcademy #YorkPA #YorkStrongerTogether #IBWorldSchool

post_text:
Stop by for free grab-and-go meals for your children today from 11:30 a.m. - 12:30 p.m. in the rear parking lot of the Lower School! Plus, Miss Schmid and Mrs. Alvarnaz will be there, and they can't wait to see you!

Today's menu choices are fish treasures with mac cheese or a cheese sandwich. A take-along breakfast will also be available for tomorrow. We hope to see you soon!

As a reminder, YARCS parents may pick up the meals and (children don't need to be along). Students from other districts are also welcome, but per federal guidelines, they must be present to receive the free meals. One meal per child will be distributed each day.

post_text:
We’re thankful to have the support of York Academy Foundation Board member Nikki McGettigan during Give Local York. She is are proud to give to the York Academy Foundation because she has seen an amazing transformation in her daughter's learning this year. Fiona is more engaged, less frustrated and loves to go to school. Nikki feels that York Academy takes learning in a different direction. For example, there can be a project that encompasses math, science and also compassion. York Academy, through its International Baccalaureate programmes, provides a challenging education to students, but also encourages them to learn to be open-minded, risk-takers and caring. It is an education not found elsewhere. Thank you, Nikki!

Please consider sharing a donation to support our students, too. Learn more and donate now at http://bit.ly/Give-Local-YARCS. Thank you!

#GiveLocalYork #YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #YorkAcademy #IBWorldSchool #YorkPA

post_text:
Second-grader, London, got a huge shoutout on social media for dancing it out in a challenge called "Da Sauce." Hip-hop artist and Grammy award-winning producer Jermaine Dupri voiced over the song and used the beat from Usher's song "Don't Waste My Time." He reposted London's Instagram video and even shared it on Facebook. It was viewed over 52,000 times on his Instagram page and almost 7,000 times on Facebook! Way to go, London. We're so proud of you! Never stop dancing!

#YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #SmoothMoves #KeepDancing #HipHop #YorkAcademy #ILoveYorkCity #YorkPA #IBWorldSchool

post_text: WE are all connected, past and present. So how will YOU help OUR future?
text: WE are all connected, past and present. So how will YOU help OUR future?

post_text:
Here's a #MondayMessage from Ms. Janel Kinard, one of our awesome Lower School physical education teachers:

Hi everyone! I have two work spaces. Based off the pictures, which one do you think I enjoy more?

What I miss most about school is being able to watch students achieve a skill they’ve been working on or watching teams work together to accomplish a goal. I miss seeing how kind the students are to one another and watching them interact in such a positive way. The only interaction I’ve seen recently is watching my dog attempt to interact with squirrels. Let’s just say, it’s not very fulfilling compared to what I’m used to seeing from our amazing students!

Miss you all dearly!
Ms. Kinard

post_text:
It's #KnightNodFriday, and we'd like to recognize second-grader, Ada! She was nominated for embracing the International Baccalaureate #attribute of being a #risktaker. Risk-takers approach uncertainty with forethought and determination. They also work independently and cooperatively to explore new ideas and innovative strategies and are resourceful and resilient in the face of challenges and change.

Ada has been such a risk-taker since beginning distance learning. She has been exploring new ideas by helping her teacher and trying out new tasks and reporting back. She uses innovative strategies by building homes and towns out of Legos! Ada is extremely resilient and faces every task with determination and open-mindedness during this time of change. Way to go, Ada. Here's a big "Knight Nod" for being such a risk-taker. Congrats and keep it up!

#YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #YARCSproud #IBWorldSchool #InternationalBaccalaureate #YorkPA #YorkStrongerTogether #ILoveYorkCity

post_text:
In the spirit of #ThankYouThursday, we're sharing this week's #KnightStaffSuperstar (formerly Staff Shoutout). A big thank you goes to Ms. Lauren Rooney for embodying the International Baccalaureate attribute of being a #thinker and putting her students first! Thinkers use critical and creative thinking skills to analyze and take responsible action on complex problems. They exercise initiative in making reasoned, ethical decisions.

Ms. Rooney has worked very hard to develop a schedule that is equitable for her students during distance learning. She communicates with families and provides support when they run into issues. Ms. Rooney cares about her students and works hard each day to support their learning. Thank you for using your creative thinking skills to make a difference, Ms. Rooney. You are appreciated!

#YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #YARCSproud #IBWorldSchool #InternationalBaccalaureate #YorkPA #YorkStrongerTogether

Yesterday, 10th grade National Art Honor Society member, Michaelina, took over the York Academy Visual Arts page! Check out her post and the beautiful pictures she shared in celebration of Earth Day!

#YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #YARCSproud #IBWorldSchool #InternationalBaccalaureate #YorkPA #YorkStrongerTogether
shared_text:
York Academy Visual Arts
April 22 at 3:12 PM ·

It's Earth Day and I think this year especially we should all appreciate the nature around us. One of the few places we can go right now is just outside, whether that's our backyards or our neighborhoods. I went on a walk with my dog Chewy (yes that is short for Chewbacca) and just took the time to look around and appreciate the blossoms of spring. I know that I feel like I've been overstaying my welcome in my own home at times, and so going outside really is a nice trip away from my room and the spring cleaning I am still avoiding. I hope everyone is finding ways to get through these uncomfortable circumstances and can take some time to stop and smell the flowers. ~ Michaelina

#yarcssocialmediatakeover #NAHS #NJAHS #10thgradeartist #staycreative #stopandsmelltheflowers York Academy Regional Charter School

post_text:
Here's a #MondayMessage from Library Assistant, Mrs. Christa Raught and her work-from-home sidekick, Flora:

Hi York Academy families!

As I don't have just one location set up in my house to work, I have been using the dining room table, the comfy couch and sometimes my bedroom floor to join Google Classroom Meets and Zoom meetings! I will say this stay-at-home time has made me more of a risk-taker, because I am using the online meetings to read to students (which I have never done before). I miss seeing you all in the York Academy library, and hope to see you all soon!

Love,
Mrs. Raught (and Flora, too)

York Academy parents may now pick up the meals (children do not need to be along). Students from other districts are also welcome, but per federal guidelines, they must be present to receive the free meals. One meal per child will be distributed each day. We look forward to seeing you soon!

The York Academy Foundation is thrilled to participate in #GiveLocalYork on Friday, May 1! We are thankful for the amazing way our community pulled together to raise funds to benefit our students last year, and we must stay focused on that mission, even in these challenging times.

This year, donations will support York Academy Scholarship+, a new college and career readiness program for students in grades seven and up. Learn more at http://bit.ly/YAF_GLY and please consider a meaningful gift of any amount on May 1. Thank you!

post_text:
Congratulations to Jocelyn, a fourth-grader who is this week's #KnightNodFriday (formerly the Student Spotlight). She was nominated for embodying the International Baccalaureate #attribute of being #principled. When we are principled, we act with integrity and honesty, with a strong sense of fairness and justice, and with respect for the dignity and rights of people everywhere. We take responsibility for our actions and their consequences.

Jocelyn has been very responsible with completing all of her assignments. She also communicates with her teachers when there is a concern. Jocelyn is very reflective of her actions and learns from her mistakes. Way to go, Jocelyn. Here's a big "Knight Nod" for being so principled. Keep it up!

#YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #YARCSproud #IBWorldSchool #InternationalBaccalaureate #ILoveYorkCity #YorkPA

post_text:
Please note that Pennsylvania schools will be closed for the rest of this academic year because of the coronavirus pandemic. The York Academy will continue to serve lunch and operate school as we have been doing. We will share additional information about grades, attendance and other topics with you next week.

To review the entire announcement from Governor Tom Wolf, go here: https://www.media.pa.gov/Pages/Education-Details.aspx?newsid=829

#YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #YARCSproud
shared_text:
Pennsylvania Department of Education
April 9 at 10:52 AM ·

Even though schools are closed, it doesn’t mean all of the important things that schools provide stops.

Teaching and learning will continue.

Free meals for kids will continue.

Connections will continue.

Find out more about this decision: https://www.media.pa.gov/Pages/Education-Details.aspx?newsid=829

Families may pick up learning materials today and Tuesday (4/14) from 11 a.m. - 1 p.m. from the Multi Purpose Room. The outside doors on North Beaver Street will be marked for this pick up.

During this time, families should pick up paperwork packets, student workbooks and a bag of helpful learning materials. Parents should also bring their school issued iPads so that important updates can be completed.

We look forward to seeing you soon!

A take along breakfast for tomorrow is also available. We hope to see you soon!

The federal government recently updated their guidelines, and York Academy parents/guardians may now pick up the meals and take them home (children do not have to be present). Please note that one meal per child will be distributed each day.

We will also continue to serve students from other districts, but per the new guidelines, the children MUST be present in the vehicle to receive the free meals. One meal per child will be distributed each day.

We hope to see you soon!

post_text:
As a reminder, our kindergarten parents are invited to come to the Lower School today from 11 a.m. - 1 p.m. to pick up packets and/or borrow an iPad for additional work and video calls with their teachers and class.

Even with Governor Wolf''s new "Stay at Home" order for York County, families are permitted to pick up these items. Materials can be picked up from the Multi Purpose Room doors at the back of the building facing Beaver Street. The door will be opened and marked for pick-up.

Per Governor Wolf, during the "Stay at Home" order, individuals may leave their residence "to travel to or from educational institutions for purposes of receiving materials for distance learning, for receiving meals, and any other related services."

#YorkAcademyUKnighted #UKnight #YARCSproud #IBWorldSchool #InternationalBaccalaureate #ILoveYorkCity #YorkPA #TogetherYork

Our #CARING crew is waiting for you! We can't thank them enough for their time, dedication, and the love they put into preparing and providing meals to our community.

Stop by today until 1:00 p.m. in the rear parking lot of the Lower School. As a reminder, the meals are for children under 18 and they must be present to receive them. Today's choices are:

Option 1: Maxi/Pizza sticks with marinara sauce, fruit, green beans, a snack and milk
Option 2: Chef Salad (while supplies last)
Option 3: Cheese Sandwich
A take-along breakfast for tomorrow is also be available.

Please note that meals will not be provided on Friday, March 27 since York Academy was scheduled to be closed. We are honoring that day off for students, teachers and staff. Thank you!

Please see this post from Mrs. Chester, our Upper School visual arts teacher (York Academy MYP Visual Arts). Feel free to draw along!

#UKnight #YorkAcademy #YARCS #InternationalBaccalaureate #IBWorldSchool #ILoveYorkCity #YorkPA #TogetherYork
shared_text:
YOUTUBE.COM
What Should We Draw? #1: 03/20/20

York Academy Visual Arts
March 20 at 12:38 PM ·

Today is our first What Should We Draw! #yarcswswd I've shared your awesomely creative suggestions with my upper school students and will hopefully have a few drawings to share with you tomorrow. In the meantime, if you'd like to draw along with us, here's a video to get you started! Kids, parents, and even folks outside of our school community are welcome to choose a prompt and draw with us! Post your drawings below in the comments or email them to rchester@yorkarcs.org.

Today's Prompts:
- Super Lizard!
- Alligator playing the flute
- Sea animal dance party
- Sloth/Cheetah race (Sloth wins!)
- All the things that are NOT canceled
- Deer gymnastics
- Your family as royalty
- Elephants building with legos
- Happy, but OLD, footwear

Have a great Friday everyone!

https://youtu.be/4kD29q5LOos

All children under 18 are welcome to participate. They do not need to attend York Academy, but per federal guidelines, they must be present to receive the bagged meals.

For the safety of others, please use caution and enter the parking lot from Cherry Lane. Pull up to the tables and our Food Services Team will bring the meals to your vehicle.

We plan to continue offering meals next week, but the hours may be adjusted. As soon as the details are confirmed, we'll make sure to update you. Thanks!

#UKnight #YorkAcademy #YARCS #Meals4KidsInPA #FreeMealsforChildren #ILoveYorkCity #YorkPA #InternationalBaccalaureate #IBWorldSchool

Students who are under 18 must be present in the vehicle to receive the free meals. Use Cherry Lane and turn right into the parking lot. Simply pull up to the tables and they'll bring the meals to you.

We are so thankful for their time and hard work to make meals available for our families even though we're not able to be together. Please stop by!

We hope to see you soon!

post_text: Please see Mrs. Chester's post below and share this with anyone you think may be interested. She's looking for ceramic artists, potters, photographers, and sequential artists (comic artists, cartoonists, story-boarders, etc.) who would be willing to spend 20-30 minutes engaging in discussion of their work and process with her classes through video conferencing while they're learning from home. Make sure to follow York Academy MYP Visual Arts, too. Thank you!
shared_text:
York Academy Visual Arts
March 17 at 11:26 PM ·

In search of ceramic artists, potters, photographers, and sequential artists (comic artists, cartoonists, storyboarders, etc.) who would be willing to spend 20-30 minutes engaging in discussion of their work and process with my classes through video conferencing while we're learning from home. Please share this request with anyone you think may be interested.

The high school level classes I'm teaching right now are Intro to Digital Photography, Ceramics I, Ceramics II, and Sequential Art. We're only a couple of weeks into the trimester, so we've not gotten very deep into content in any of the classes. Any level of artisan/artist is welcome and would be much appreciated!

My email: rchester@yorkarcs.org

Please share! The joy of this situation is that we truly can meet with anyone anywhere in the world!

Thanks for your help in reaching out to our local and global neighbors!

post_text: As a reminder, even though students are doing schoolwork from home, it's important to monitor your child's online activity. We are reviewing flagged activity and contacting parents, as needed, but our monitoring system will not catch everything. We also urge you to charge all devices in your room overnight so students are not using them during bedtime hours. We need your help to vigilantly monitor their online presence to ensure their safety. Thank you and take care!

In efforts to assist York County navigate the COVID-19 pandemic, along with assistance from a bevy of government, civic, and community partners www.PreparedYork.com is now live. This website is accessible in numerous languages!

This site is a compilation of information to assist businesses, non-profits, and employees with resources and information.

www.preparedyork.com

post_text: Our AWESOME Food Services Team is ready for you! We are thankful for their time and hard work to make meals available for the community even though we're not able to be together! They'll be here until 1:30 p.m. to offer drive through grab and go bagged meals in the rear parking lot of the Lower School. Anyone under the age of 18 who is present in the vehicle will receive a free meal. We look forward to seeing you!

post_text:
As a reminder, our Food Services Department is offering drive through grab and go bagged meals today from 11:30 a.m. - 1:30 p.m. in the rear parking lot of the Lower School. Anyone under the age of 18 who is present in the vehicle will receive a free meal. Here's what's on the menu:

Choice 1: Chef Salads with Ranch Dressing, Bug Bites (graham cookies), Apple Slices, Baby Carrots and Milk

Choice 2: Cheese Sandwich, Bug Bites (graham cookies), Apple Slices, Baby Carrots and Milk

Take Along Breakfast for Tomorrow: Mini Pancakes (can be heated in the microwave), Maple Syrup, Juice Box and Milk

Upper School students may also pick up their Chromebooks or any items they need until 1:00 p.m. Thank you!

shared_text:
The DEW Good Academy Cafe
March 16 at 6:56 AM ·

In order to keep our staff and customers safe and healthy the cafe will be closed beginning today Monday, March 16th and remain closed at least for the next two weeks. Please follow our page for our reopening date. Thank you for your understanding and patience during this time.
